Package com.jme.scene.plugins.blender.meshes

Class IndexesLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme.scene.plugins.blender.meshes.IndexesLoop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Integer>
    public class IndexesLoop
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Integer>, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>
    This class represents the Face's indexes loop. It is a simplified implementation of directed graph.
    Author:
    Marcin Roguski (Kaelthas)

      • IndexesLoop

        public IndexesLoop​(java.lang.Integer[] nodes)
        The constructor uses the given nodes in their give order. Each neighbour indexes will form an edge.
        Parameters:
        nodes - the nodes for the loop

      • removeEdge

        public boolean removeEdge​(java.lang.Integer node1,
                          java.lang.Integer node2)
        Removes edge from the face. The edge is removed if it already exists in the face.
        Parameters:
        node1 - the first index of the edge to be removed
        node2 - the second index of the edge to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the edge was removed and false otherwise

        Tells if the given indexes are neighbours.
        Parameters:

        index2 - the second index
        Returns:
        true if the given indexes are neighbours and false otherwise

      • getNextIndex

        public java.lang.Integer getNextIndex​(java.lang.Integer index)
        Returns the value of the index located after the given one. Pointint the last index will return the first one.
        Parameters:
        index - the index value
        Returns:
        the value of 'next' index

      • getPreviousIndex

        public java.lang.Integer getPreviousIndex​(java.lang.Integer index)
        Returns the value of the index located before the given one. Pointint the first index will return the last one.
        Parameters:
        index - the index value
        Returns:
        the value of 'previous' index

      • shiftIndexes

        public void shiftIndexes​(int shift,
                         IndexesLoop.IndexPredicate predicate)
        The method shifts all indexes by a given value.
        Parameters:
        shift - the value to shift all indexes
        predicate - the predicate that verifies which indexes should be shifted; if null then all will be shifted

      • reverse

        public void reverse()
        Reverses the order of the indexes.

      • removeIndexes

        public void removeIndexes​(java.lang.Integer... indexes)
        The method removes all given indexes.
        Parameters:
        indexes - the indexes to be removed

      • findPath

        public void findPath​(java.lang.Integer start,
                     java.lang.Integer end,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> result)
              throws BlenderFileException
        The method finds the path between the given indexes.
        Parameters:
        start - the start index
        end - the end index
        result - a list containing indexes on the path from start to end (inclusive)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - an exception is thrown when the loop is not normalized (at least one index has more than 2 neighbours)
        BlenderFileException - an exception is thrown if the vertices of a face create more than one loop; this is thrown to prevent lack of memory errors during triangulation

        public java.lang.String toString()
